New Records: Lane Thomas hit a grand slam, the first postseason slam for the Guardians since 2017.
Steven Kwan extended his postseason hitting streak to 10 games, tying Kenny Lofton for the longest in team history.
Key Match Events: Lane Thomas' grand slam in the fifth inning turned the tide of the game.
Emmanuel Clase secured the save with two innings of work.
The Tigers' late rally in the seventh inning kept the game close.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Stephen Vogt emphasized the team's belief and preparation before the game.
The Tigers took an early lead but were quickly countered by the Guardians.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Stephen Vogt praised the Tigers and reflected on the series' intensity.
The Guardians' win advanced them to the ALCS for the first time since 2016.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The series featured 18 total games between the teams, with the Guardians winning 10.
The Tigers had opportunities to win but were outperformed in key moments.
Others: The game set up the Guardians' preparation for the ALCS against the Yankees.
